word: A Delayed Harvest.--The priests were convinced of the divine power of the Saviour. . . . Many hearts were moved that for a time made no sign. During the Saviour's life, His mission seemed to call forth little response of love from the priests and teachers; but after His ascension "a great company of the priests were obedient to the faith."--The Desire of Ages, p. 266. (1898)
